note: The language is of the Abkhaz-Adyghean (North West Caucasian) language family. It is spoken by over 300 thousand people, mostly in the Republic of Adyghea (Russian Federation). ć, ć̣, ḳ, ʁ, ś, ṭ, χ, ʒ, ʔ are specific cosonants; ə and y are vowels.
